title: The Brave Toto Boy
english_narration: Once upon a time in a Toto village near the forest, a young boy named Ruba heard his village drum beating loudly. A tiger had entered the farms! Instead of running away, Ruba took his small drum and beat it bravely to distract the tiger. Hearing the sound, the elders came running and chased it away. The village called Ruba 'The Brave Toto Boy'. From that day, he became a symbol of courage and unity.
cultural_meaning: Bravery and unity protect the community
suggested_image: A boy with drum, tiger in background

title: The River and the Drum
english_narration: Long ago, the Toto people believed the river had a soul. Every evening, the sound of the drum from the village echoed across the water. The river loved the sound so much that it flowed gently, bringing fresh fish to the people. But one year, the drummers stopped playing. The river became sad and dry. When the villagers realized, they played the drum again — and the river danced back with joy.
cultural_meaning: Nature listens to our actions, respect and stay connected to it
suggested_image: River flowing near drummer under moonlight
